title: Diesel Scam in India
selftext: I recently stopped at a HP Corp. Ltd to fill Diesel in our car at Ranjangaon, Pune & I immediately noticed that the Density of the Petrol was too below the Actual Density Limit set in India which is 820-845 kg/m³, My dad wasn't really paying attention to what i was saying. The motive of uploading this post is to stay aware whenever you are filling up your tank from an unknown village-side FuelPump!! Jaihind
comments: This is new information to me. We can assume the fuel quality of a fuel station based on the density displayed? How effective is this value in conveying the fuel quality I just want to ask?
